About Colby College

We nurture thoughtful, engaged individuals ready to make a difference in a global society. Colby College is a private liberal arts college in Waterville, Maine, United States. Founded in 1813 as the Maine Literary and Theological Institution, it was renamed Waterville College in 1821

Academic Programs

  • 128 credits minimum, 2.00 GPA
  • 64 credits on campus
  • First‑Year Writing course
  • Foreign Language requirement
  • Areas: Arts, History, Literature, Math, Social Sciences

See full info in the Course Catalog.

Student Life

2,282 undergraduates, 100+ clubs, student newspaper, radio, and wellness services.

A great school that will shape you into the person you want to be.

Over 10% international students from more than 80 countries.

Notable Alumni

  • Hannibal Hamlin – VP under Lincoln
  • Lucia Cormier – Trailblazing politician and women’s rights advocate
  • Stephen King – Renowned author who attended Colby
  • Charles Mayo – Co‑founder of the Mayo Clinic
  • Daniel Wathen – Former Chief Justice of the Maine Supreme Judicial Court
  • Dean Kamen – Inventor of the Segway and medical technology innovator
  • Jeffrey Donovan – Actor known for roles in "Burn Notice" and "Fargo"
  • Anna Kendrick – Actress and singer, known for "Pitch Perfect" and "Up in the Air"
  • Elizabeth Strout – Pulitzer Prize‑winning author of "Olive Kitteridge"

Colby graduates have made significant contributions across government, business, social justice, environmental advocacy, and academia. The college’s emphasis on critical thinking and adaptability equips alumni to thrive in diverse fields. Alumni actively support current students through mentorship, internships, and career networking, while also contributing to the college’s continued success.

Community & Networking

Global alumni network provides mentorship, career support, and lifelong connection. Colby College offers networking opportunities through Colby Connect, an online platform for alumni and students, and through DavisConnects, its career center. The college also has a global network of alumni clubs, a formal alumni council, and holds various networking events, such as summer receptions in major cities and on-campus events.
